page.title: 20SUPERNATURAL IN MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: A famous man of our past was Syr Howel y Fwyall(Sir Howel of the Axe) of Bron y Foel,always the most important farm in the area.He fought for the Black Prince at Poitiers and took the French king prisoner after cutting off his horse's head with his battle axe.Howel died about 1372,but still haunts the hillsides of his birthplace. A ghostly visitor to the village is a white stallion,thought by some to be the French king's horse.One night he peered in at a caravan window and caused such terror that the family inside returned to their safe home in England next morning.
